messages.content: ComfyUI-Gemini is a project that integrates Google Gemini into ComfyUI, allowing users to generate prompts, describe images, and engage in conversations using the Gemini model.
What are the three models currently provided by Gemini?
Gemini currently provides three models: Gemini-pro (text model), Genimi-pro-vision (text + image model), and Gemini 1.5 Pro (text + image + file model).
What are the key features of the Gemini 1.5 Pro model?

The Gemini 1.5 Pro model supports system instruction settings, multi-modal and multi-turn conversations, reading video and audio files (up to 20G), and has a token input limit of 1,048,576. However, it has strict rate limits, with only 2 requests per minute and 1,000 requests per day.
What types of nodes are available in ComfyUI-Gemini?
ComfyUI-Gemini offers two types of nodes: implicit API KEY nodes (recommended) and explicit API KEY nodes (for private use only).
How can users obtain a Gemini API key?
Users can apply for a Gemini API key by visiting the Gemini API application page: https://makersuite.google.com/app/apikey.
What is the recommended installation method for ComfyUI-Gemini?
The recommended installation method is to use the ComfyUI Manager to install ComfyUI-Gemini.
How can users support the development of ComfyUI-Gemini?
Users can support the development of ComfyUI-Gemini by visiting the creator's Bilibili page, following them on social media, or making a donation through the provided links.
